page.title: 12Level Farm.
page.content: Level Farm situated 4km south of Elgin is owned by Eagle Star Insurance Company and rented by Mr Campbell. The farm occupies 224 acres. The name level comes from the gaelic labael meaning boggy. It has several byres and a silage pit made of railway sleepers. Barley is grown for malting. Mr Campbell normally works an 8 hour day but 16 in harvest. He has 250 cattle bought in for Â£300 and sold a year later for Â£450. He buys Limousin, Charolais and Simmental at 9 different marts from Oban to Elgin. Winter food is silage,hay,propcorned barley and some cattle cake. In winter he runs 400 sheep. Farming has become more expensive but much easier with all the modern machinery which he owns.
